title: Man arrested in 5-year-old's shooting
content:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- Police have made an arrest in the case of a child shot last month just north of uptown Charlotte.
According to Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police, officers responded to the 7-Eleven at the corner of Dalton Avenue and North Tryon Street a little after 9 p.m. on Thursday, November 10.
When they arrived, officers found a 5-year-old girl suffering from a gunshot wound. The girl was taken by MEDIC to CMC, where she underwent surgery.
CMPD says that a vehicle with three adults and the child was traveling on 12th Street when a vehicle pulled up to them. A person in that vehicle then fired multiple shots into the car, hitting the child.
Investigators identified 27-year-old Patrick Glenn as the suspect in the shooting. Police say that Glenn has outstanding warrants for assault with a deadly weapon, discharging a firearm into occupied dwelling causing serious injury, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Police say it appears the suspect knew one of the adult males in the victim vehicle.
Glenn was arrested Tuesday and taken into custody. He's charged with assault with a deadly weapon inflicting serious injury, four counts of assault with a deadly weapon, discharging a firearm into occupied vehicle in operation causing serious injury and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
